name: 1886 Cafe & Bakery - Driskill Hotel
review description: I had the Hickory Roasted half Chicken for $15.00 and the other person had the Austin, TX Burger, this person enjoyed the burger but I did NOT enjoyed the chicken. I could tell that they had just reheated the chicken to lukewarm stage and poured over the hickory sauce! The side dish of spinach I had was a little on the sour side! I'm sorry to say that I did not enjoyed as much as the first!! I have had the High Tea, which I will recommend. Very nice High Tea but it's $$$$!

name: 34th Street Cafe
review description: 34th Street cuisine never disappoints. Consistent, great food at reasonable prices. Good wine list. Wonderful neighborhood venue.

name: ALC Steaks (Austin Land & Cattle)
review description: Meh. I've been to ALC before, but it had been awhile. I was surprised at how much the building has deteriorated, & there was a distinct "old house" smell - slightly mildewy. We were seated (in a mostly empty restaurant) right by the kitchen entrance. Okay, I guess, until right after we got our appetizer we were overpowered with what smelled like wintergreen dip. Air freshener to mask the mildew smell? Cleaning solution? We asked to move tables & were accommodated (with only a slight eye roll). New table was better, food was good (though I wasn't crazy about the steak rub). Service was fair - our waiter kind of forgot about us after our entrees came. All in all, not a stellar dining experience. The best part was the current art work.

name: ASTI Trattoria
review description: It's rare to find a restaurant where every single course is excellent, but Asti definitely fits the bill. My husband and I each had different salads and different entrees (sharing a side and dessert), and we were both ecstatic with our selections. The portions aren't the three-meals in one you sometimes get at Italian restaurants, but they aren't the 2-ounces-of-food-with-parsley you get at other restaurants of this quality, either. I was full without the dessert and side, but I ate them anyway (they were delicious!). It was not overpriced for the quality or the size, but ordering a lot of food will add up (2 entrees, 2 salads, 1 wine, 1 side, and 1 dessert ran us about $85). I highly recommend it, and will definitely be back.

name: ate.cafe
review description: Went there for Easter brunch. Food was fresh and tasty. Portions were large. Coffee was excellent although the cups were too small!

name: August E's
address: 203 East San Antonio Street Fredericksburg, TX  78624
review description: Nice place. Good food. I was a little annoyed that they were out of the two items on the menu that I thought were reasonably priced (the new York strip my first choice for $41, and the Pork chop my second choice for $25) were both sold out at 7:15pm. Then my only other choice for steak were $80 and $65. I'm sure they were probably great choices, but a little pricey for my budget. I ended up going with the "off the menu" choice of sea scallopes. Which was good, but not really what I was in the mood for. I understand sometimes restaurants run out of things, but really, the first two items on your menu and it's only 7:15 on a Saturday?

name: Bartlett's
review description: Been going here for 25 years and always come back.

name: Botticelli's
review description: It was our first visit but I had been wanting to try it for sometime. It was as good as we all hoped it would be. Good service, great food (the butter lettuce salad was great - as was the chicken dish....). We will difinitely return and enjoy the back outdoor space! There is a lack of Italian restaurants in Austin and this one is a good one!

name: Braise
review description: Had the 4 course special offer.. excellent pumpkin bisque, osso bucco was a little peppery for my taste but tender, good crab cake and great desserts.

name: Brizo's
review description: The cost of the brunch was a little out of line for the spread tht was served.

name: Buca di Beppo - Austin
review description: Excellent evening, great food and birthday party for my grandson.

name: Cafe Josie
review description: Cafe Josie is simply one of the best restaurants in Austin. The food is always terrific and the staff is friendly and professional.

name: Cafe Malta
address: 3421 W. William Cannon Dr., #127 Austin, TX  78745
review description: A friend and I shared the spinach salad (overdressed, but otherwise fine) and I had the grouper with risotto/asparagus/red cabbage. Fish was dry, but corn risotto was heavenly; I could have inhaled a whole 'nother bowl of it! My asparagus was overcooked (shriveled, dry) but my friend's was perfect. Red cabbage was a nice touch; loved it. We shared the lemon curd shortbread for dessert. Lemon curd was good; shortbread was actually NOT shortbread, but a biscuit. And it was dry. And hard. VERY (on both counts).

name: Cantina Laredo - Austin
review description: We left the experience with a "meh" feeling. The service was slow. It was apparent that they were under staffed on the evening of July 4th. They were trying...the busboy was friendly and accommodating as he could be. The ceviche was fishy and room temperature. Salsa wasn't refilled. This was necessary as we ran out of salsa during the long ansences in service. The frozen margaritas had probably been sitting in the window for a while as they arrived partially melted. The salted rim wasn't really.

name: Carillon Restaurant
review description: This is one of Austin's best, but least known, restaurants. The food, service, and ambiance are all top-of-the-line. It's also pleasantly quite. I would highly recommend The Carillon.

name: Carmelo's Ristorante Italiano - Austin
review description: We had a wonderful time, the food was realy fantastic, and the employees' simply made everything simple and effortless. This was a wonderful experience and I would recomend this to anyone.

name: Chez Zee
review description: Lovely place for a Sunday brunch with friends, family, or even someone you'd like to impress! Broad menu choices, well prepared and presented. We didn't all make the "right" choice (the grits and eggs special was only so-so), but those of us who did thought the food was excellent.

name: Cipollina
review description: This is our traditional place we come for our anniversary each year and have been coming for many years. Food is good, reasonable and the service is great.

name: Clay Pit
review description: Had access to a private room for our party of 14. Food was great, atmosphere was fantastic. Service needed quite a bit of work. Our server couldn't handle 14. Could have used a second set of hands. Even if it was just for water refills. Had a hard time getting second round of drinks. Had to go look for our server on a few occasions.

name: Congress
review description: We enjoyed the tasting menu as our dinner.

name: Contigo Austin
review description: This place was wonderful. The menu/food was fantastic (try the fried green beans!), and we were surprised that with as high quality as the food was, how low the prices were. They accommodate big groups very well, and we had a TON of food, and lots to drink, and only ended up paying about $30/person. In my opinion, if you only have a weekend in Austin, this is one place you HAVE to go.

name: Cool River Cafe - Austin
review description: The waitress was very informative regarding the specials. She was very warm, friendly and professional. This was one the best dining experiences to date.

name: Copa Bar and Grill
review description: Good food but not good enough for that price...

name: Cotton Gin Cabernet Grill
review description: Cosmopolitan drinks were Very GOOD!Steaks were cooked perfectly to order. All other entree's were delicious.Desserts were a nice surprise.Service a plus!We will all go back again!

name: Cypress Grill
address: 4404 W William Cannon Dr., Ste L Austin, TX  78749
review description: The food was excellent and the service was cheerful

name: Daily Grill - Austin
address: 11506 Century Oaks Terrace Suite 100 Austin, TX  78758
review description: We love this restaurant! It has never failed to come through with awesome offerings. Our waitperson was great (Marquae) and the manager stopped by our table to see if we were enjoying our meal. His name is Emmanuel. These are all great people who make you feel welcome. Again, we really like this gem of a restaurant at the Domain.

name: Driskill Grill - Driskill Hotel
review description: My wife and I went to the Driskill Grill to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The place exceeded our expectations. The waitstaff was friendly and helpful, without being intrusive. We would highly recommend the Driskill Grill to anyone looking for a quiet, romantic atmosphere.

name: Eddie V's - 5th Street
review description: Excellent food and service. Pricey but worth it. We did have a table in the middle of the room and with all the activity sometimes it felt like we were in Grand Central Station, so you might want to ask for a table along a wall/window.

name: Eddie V's - Arboretum
review description: Great food. Great service. Great for expense account dinners.

name: eleven plates & wine
address: 3801 N Capital of Texas Hwy Ste. C-200 Austin, TX  78746
review description: Food and Service were very nice. The restaurant was very quiet for a Friday night, I think some advertising might help keep them busier to stay in business.

name: The Emerald Restaurant
review description: We had a great time. The service was extra ordinary. We could talk and not have to shout which was wonderful for the evening.

name: Estancia Churrascaria - Arboretum
address: 10000 Research Blvd. Suite B Austin, TX  78759
review description: This was our first visit, and we loved it! The food was fabulous, and the service was even better. The waitstaff were so attentive and never let us get an empty glass or plate. It was a wonderful experience!

name: finn & porter
address: Hilton Austin 500 E 4th St. Austin, TX  78701
review description: The food was great! My boyfriend and I decided to have dinner here while we were visiting Austin for the weekend and I am sure glad we did. Our waitress was wonderful so friendly and very helpful. This is a place I would surely come back to.

name: FINO Restaurant, Patio, and Bar
review description: Great tapas!!! Excellent variety, fresh and well prepared

name: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Austin
review description: It was great the food was excellent steakhouse fare. Went out of their way to make us and our 3 year old comfortable. The server was excellent.

name: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Austin The Domain
review description: We went for my birthday. The service was fine, but not spectacular. My steak was tasty but had gristle running through half of it. It was cooked perfectky. My companion had a filet, which although looked perfect, he said was over-charred and even tough in places. Their potatoes are awesome. The chocolate walnut pie was tasty, but not spectacular. Overall, we enjoyed it but expected more for the $200 price tag.

name: Fore
address: 900 Ranch Rd 620 S, Ste B108 Lakeway, TX  78734
review description: Good Fathers Day brunch. The reservation gave us a perfect place to see & hear my 2 teenage guitar students who were performing. All in all a good time.

name: Garrido's Restaurant
review description: I plan on visiting this place again. Our waitress could have been better and I would have preferred that she not ask my 14 year old, baby faced daughter in pigtails if she was old enough to have a mimosa after having already brought it to the table. But I liked the fish tacos and the feel of the restaurant so I'm not going to hold the actions of one against the place.

name: The Grille At Rough Hollow
review description: We've had a good moment in this restaurant close to the yacht club. Outside, from a terrace there is a nice view of the Marina. We went on a Sunday at 1:30 pm, the atmosphere was quiet and our meal was delicious. We will go back for sure.

name: Gumbo's Louisiana Style Cafe - Downtown
review description: We asked for a quiet place and they found the quietest in the restaurant, thank you very much.

name: Gumbo's Steak and Seafood - Bee Cave
review description: Salmon Robert is always excellent. Salads are always crisp and fresh. Highly recomend.

name: gusto italian kitchen + wine bar
address: 4800 Burnet Road Suite B-200 Austin, TX  78756
review description: Very enjoyable evening. Matthew is always very pleasant and makes you feel welcome. Their pasta dishes are very good. We also had their version of chopped salad and it too was yummy. I wish though that they had more selections for dessert. The pistachio gelato was excellent though!

name: Haddingtons
review description: Nice and cozy interior with outside patio seating. We attempted patio but no ceiling fans to circulate air.Our waiter was very attentive and offered a cheese selection to pair with our French wine. For entree' we had the musselsand lamb chops. Mussels were steamed and nothing special. Several of the shells were closed. Lamb Chops were preparedas ordered and just ok. We love the atmosphere and will give Haddington's another try.

name: Hemingway Restaurant and Bar
address: 500 Cypress Creek Rd., Ste 170 Cedar Park, TX  78613
review description: Really like the look of the place, great outdoor space. Food was solidly good.

name: Hudson's On The Bend
review description: 3 in our party had the 3 course tasting menu. You get to choose between two options for each course so we were able to try everything on that menu. The food was fantastic, but the Talapia won overall! My son ordered a platter that included alligator and frog legs. His absolute favorite was the alligator! Who knew? Our experience could not have been better. The waiter was attentive and very pleasant.

name: Hyatt Lost Pines - Firewheel Cafe
address: 575 Hyatt Lost Pines Road Cedar Creek, TX  78612
review description: Ate Christmas Brunch in the Firewheel Cafe. Nice selection but the food was just so-so. Overall a nice time and the service is excellent.

name: Hyde Park Bar & Grill - Duval
review description: Love the french fries. Sonora salad was great.

name: Hyde Park Bar & Grill - West Gate
address: 4521 B West Gate Blvd Austin, TX  78745
review description: Went to Hyde Park Bar & Grill- Westgate for my birthday dinner. I had made reservations prior, so that helped with getting the table for 8 that my party consisted of. We were seated on time. The waiter showed up right away, took everyone's drink orders, and asked if we wanted appetizers. Drinks showed up pretty soon after ordering. Then orders were taken for dinner. I ordered the basil grilled chicken with wild rice pilaf and spice roasted sweet potatoes. My boyfriend ordered the chicken fried steak with fries and steamed broccoli. My sisters had the pork roast shephards pie and grilled salmon. Their boyfriends had the potato-crusted tilapia and chicken fried chicken. Overall, everyone was pleased with their meals. Waiter had BAD BAD breath

name: III Forks Austin
review description: The wait staff and bar staff were very attentive to our needs and assisted us in all of the nights interest. Ernest, the matire d was very friendly and invormative about the restaurant and area. We would go back next time we are in Austin.many thanksRobert Fowlkes

name: Imperia
review description: We loved it! It was a special occasion for my 17 year old son. The fortune cookie surprise was the icing on the cake for the evening!

name: Jasper's - Austin
review description: Friends from out of town were very pleased with the food, drinks and ambiance. Thank you for a memorable time.

name: Josey's
review description: I went up to the hostess and told her I had a reservation, she said she did not see one, but we could enjoy brunch. I told her I recieved a confirmation e-mail saying I had a reservation to sit outside on the patio and eat, but she ushered us to a table inside by the brunch buffet. Not at all what I wanted, nor did she try to hear what I had to say. Will not be going back.

name: Judges' Hill Restaurant
review description: We went for our 15th anniversary. First time there. Food is very different from a III Forks, or steak house. Review menu first on line to make sure they have something for you. Excellent atmosphere, setting, and service. Food had a great presentation, and was excellent. Highly recommend everyone tries it. This was our first time there, and we had heard many good things about it.

name: Kenichi
review description: Celebrated our Annivesary there and had a terrific experience. Innovative dishes and excellent sake choices.

name: Kona Grill - Austin
address: 11410 Century Oaks Terrace The Domain Austin, TX  78758
review description: Love the generous portion sizes and the unique offerings.

name: La Condesa
review description: The food was very good - the street corn was ridiculously good.

name: Lambert's Downtown BBQ
review description: We really enjoyed Lamberts. Not a very romantic feel for our date night but overall a great place! The tables are close together and it's very lively. Not the lightest of menu choices but we knew that going in and the brisket did not disappoint. Service was average. A great place to check out!

name: Lantana Grill
address: 200 Hi Circle North Horseshoe Bay, TX  78657
review description: We were so disappointed in the Lantana Grill. The reviews stated it was a wonderful Hill-Country grill, with great ambiance. It's a hotel restaurant, with an interesting menu, although the food was not good. We were expecting a nice, quiet restaurant with some atmosphere. Will not return.

name: Las Palomas Restaurant-Bar
review description: Wonderful margaritas! Always has been.Wish the rice was a little more exciting.

name: Maggiano's - Austin
review description: This was our 6th or 7th time to visit Maggiano's and I've found it to be consistant in the quality of food, service, and value. We always order from the classic menu and I don't think that you can find a better value for the money. The servers handle larger groups as easily as they do couples, and the food quality has never been bad. Our home and back deck is still the front-runner, but after that Maggiano's has become our go-to place for family celebrations.

name: Malaga Tapas & Bar
review description: My first time to Malagas and I will definitely be back soon. The food was delicious! Our waitress was friendly and the service was outstanding.

name: Manuel's Downtown
review description: Really good food - really good drinks. Pretty decent wine list too. Service was very good. Will definitely eat there again.

name: Manuel's Great Hills
review description: Nice patio. With a walking distance from a movie theater, so a dinner and a movie night is a good occasion. Three or four vegetarian options.

name: Max's Wine Dive - Austin
review description: A little loud for lunch, and the fried chicken isn't on the lunch menu but they'll make it and is worth it!

name: McCormick & Schmick's Seafood - Austin (Century Oaks)
review description: I had to keep asking for drinks.. then I had to ask for drinks for the ladies that were with me. At one point I had to ask the water boy to get my waiter. BTW it wasn't even busy and now I know why.

name: The Melting Pot - Austin - Northwest
review description: I really enjoyed my dinner! The only thing that I would want to mention was how long it took to get drinks. There was quite a few times that I did not have a drink. Then when the waiter did come to refill it would take another 10 min. before a drink would show up.

name: NoRTH - Austin
review description: Kind of disappointed in my most recent trip to NoRTH. I don't get many chances to eat at the restaurant, so I was very excited about my visit. Getting reservations was easy (thanks, OpenTable), and my wife and I got seated promptly. Unfortunately, our seating was the only thing that was prompt. Our server's visits to our table were few and far between. We waited nearly 20 minutes after we were ready to order before he stopped by our table. Next the food was very late to arrive--20 minutes for a salad and 45 minutes for a single pizza. After complaining we got no explanation for the delay or offer to compensate. Luckily the food itself was still VERY good. I'll chalk this one up to a rare bad night for the wait staff.

name: Old Pecan St. Cafe
review description: We had a Ladies Night Out (6 of us). We ate at the Pecan St. Cafe then went to Esthers Follies. Returned to the Cafe for dessert after the show. The food was great and out water was very good.

name: Olive and June
review description: Curious to see how this location would rebound. With the menu, service, and food quality Olive & June brings to bear, I sure hope it succeeds. The piccoli piatti set the stage beautifully and almost obviated the need for an entree. I often complain that Italian is too bland to be worth the extra dollars for "premium" Italian fare. Not the case here. The carbonara was exceptional and turns out the "extra dollars" aren't that many. Great value. Will most definitely be back soon.

name: Paggi House
review description: I was honestly a lil under impressed with the food. Great wine list and ambiance but I felt the food was less than amazing (which i was hoping for.) I have been before over a year or so ago- and I really remembered the food being much better. Good just not great.

name: Parkside
review description: Very noisy on a Wednesday night. But food was very good, not spectacular but enjoyable, and service, even on a busy night, was attentive and prompt. Valet parking is a bit pricey, but appreciated in the mid E. 6th Street busy-ness.

name: Peche
review description: Both the food and the cocktails were top notch. The place is right next door to Cedar Street which is a loud out door bar that features live music. We were in the restaurant while sound check was going on next door, and that was annoying as it was quite loud. I imagine it would be difficult to carry on a conversation when the bands are actually playing.

name: Perla's Seafood and Oyster Bar
address: 1400 S Congress Suite B100 Austin, TX  78704
review description: Excellent dining experience--will definitely return!

name: Perry's Steakhouse & Grille - Downtown
review description: I have always liked Perry's in Houston, Clear Lake, and in the Woodlands. the food is excellent. this was our first visit to the Perry's in Austin. The atmosphere was great, the food was great, but we had to wait way too long for our food to be served and when it was served it was not cooked to our satisfaction and had to go beck to the kitchen to be cooked longer. As far as a first impression with Perry's I would not go back again. However, I do like the food and will give them another try. This was our anniversary and the service added a little damper to it.

name: Posado's - Austin
review description: The reservation was not received by Posada's through OpenTable. I called to verify and the reservation was not handled until I walked in the door. It took them 15-20 mins to set us up.

name: Ranch 616
review description: Restaurant was crowded and noisy, but the food was good.

name: Roaring Fork-North Austin, Stonelake
review description: Pretty noisy but overall very nice.

name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Austin
address: 107 W. 6th Street The Scarborough Building Austin, TX  78701
review description: As always, the food, atmosphere and service was exceptional.

name: The Salty Sow
review description: Overall we REALLY enjoyed the food. We had a little mishap with drinks spilled on me but accidents happen! That said, this won't keep us from coming back as the food was delicious and the service was good. I really loved the decor as well. We will definitely recommend this place to our friends.

name: Satay Restaurant
address: 3202 W. Anderson Lane Ste #205 Austin, TX  78757
review description: Our food was delicious and hot. The chocolate moose(sp) pie was amazing!

name: Satellite Bistro and Bar
review description: This place came as a surprise. We were there late on a Monday night, and were the last ones served. It wasan excellent meal. Very flavorful lettuce wraps, followed by some excellent salads and main courses. All ata very reasonable price. I strongly recommend.

name: Second Bar + Kitchen
review description: Awesome food and great service!

name: Shore Club
review description: Excellent view and easy acces to the marina for all your water sports needs!best in Tx !

name: Siena Ristorante Toscano
address: 6203 Capital of Texas Hwy Austin, TX  78731
review description: Siena has become our favorite Italian restaurant in Austin. Both the food and the service are outstanding!

name: Steiner Ranch Steakhouse
review description: Our first time and thought the food was great service could have been a bit more attentive waited more than usual for our order to be taken. Nice touch with birthday surprise at the end of the meal. Overall a good experience

name: Stories Fine Dining Establishment at Hyatt Regency Lost Pines
address: 575 Hyatt Lost Pines Rd. Cedar Creek, TX  78612
review description: We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and the staff went out of its way to make it a very special evening. From the romantic booth to the glass of champagne, from the friendly staff to the delicious food, we enjoyed very minute.

name: Sullivan's Steakhouse - Austin
review description: One of my favorite places to eat in Austin

name: Sushi Zushi of 5th Street
review description: Great place to try different types of Sushi. The menu has traditional and unique choices for sushi as well as other types of Asian food.

name: Sushi Zushi of the Domain
review description: I took my wife for our anniversary dinner. Though we had had Sushi before, we had not been to a sushi restaurant. I was looking for something different for us and after the reviews on Open Table I thought it would fit the bill.

name: SWB @ the Hyatt Regency Austin
review description: This was recommended to me by a GSR at another hotel, and it was the worst experience I've ever had, bar none. We only saw our server twice, but when she brought us the check, she was friendly as can be. It took 45 minutes to get our food and we got it before people who were there far before we were. It seemed as though the staff and kitchen couldnt handle the magnitude of service that was there. You should probably get an entire new crew. I went down to the concierge, who was probably the friendliest person I came across. Kudos to her. She was the only person who made us feel welcome in the entire place.

name: Swift's Attic
review description: Found this place by reading the reviews and decided to try it even though they were a bit mixed. Everything was great and the food was brought out in an order that really enhanced the experience. No rushing and each server that brought the food out expertly explained the dish and how it was prepared. Fabulous!

name: Trace - W - Austin
review description: Outstanding vegan alternative provided by the chef. Great evening!

name: Trento
address: 3600D N. Capital of Texas Hwy. Austin, TX  78746
review description: We made our first visit to Trento for Sunday brunch and we were delighted with what we found. Our server was warm, welcoming and attentive, and the food was delicious. We sampled six different dishes and were happy with all our choices. Of note were the sumptuous citrus Hollandaise that enrobed the Prosciutto Benedict, and the Sausage Omelet. If dinner is half this good, Trento will be around in Westlake for a long time to come. Welcome to the neighborhood!

name: TRIO - Four Seasons Austin
review description: One of the best restaurants I've ever been to.

name: Truluck's Seafood, Steak and Crab House - Austin Arboretum
review description: Overall experience was very good, would have been exceelnt excpet for 1 item. I've been to Trulueck's several times and it has always been very, very good but pricey. I had to send back my meal back as it wasn't hot. It was corrected and the comped a drink for the trouble. Crab cakes were great and the carrot cake was to die for...excellent! Too big for 1 person. .

name: Truluck's Seafood, Steak and Crab House - Austin Downtown
review description: Food was outstanding. Enjoyed the piano music, but the speakers were too loud. Had to ask to turn down the volume.

name: Uchi
review description: Best sushi I have had in Austin Hands down. The meal at Uchi is more of an experience than just a sit down meal. I plan to go back soon.

name: Uchiko
address: 4200 N Lamar Blvd. Suite 140 Austin, TX  78756
review description: excellent service, and outstanding delicacies.

name: urban an american grill
review description: Outstanding service and well-prepared meal!

name: Vince Young Steakhouse
review description: We heard wonderful reviews from Rob Balon months ago about your restaurant....However, as usual....We dine out so infrequently. We've been trying to go out monthly with two other couples for the past few months. We discussed the Vince Young establishment....But hadn't acted to go until the "rain" Monday nite. It was our turn to pick up the tab...So Vince Young it was. My husband & I were so pleased when our friends repeatly said 'It was the best steak they've had in a long time.'Four of us arrived late during the deluge of rain.....TOTALLY soaked. Was quite amazed to learn your restaurant offered shawls to use. I have never known a restaurant to make that offer. We women were impressed.

name: wink
address: 1014 North Lamar Blvd. Ste. E Austin, TX  78703
review description: Increadable service and food. Everything was perfect and the lemon meringue dessert was ecstasy.

name: Zandunga Mexican Bistro
review description: Chef Edgar always delights from the kitchen. Since I've ordered everything on the menu, I now typically lean toward the special because it's always delicious, unexpected, and something I wouldn't (or couldn't) cook at home. Dawn and Christina in the front of the house are superb: efficient and concerned about the food and service. I couldn't ask for better in a restaurant.

name: Zax Restaurant & Bar
review description: Absolutely my favorite restaurant in Austin! The food is scrumptious and the service spectacular. Their signature Zax's eggs are to die for and I just love the bloody mary bar and crazy beer selection!

name: Z'Tejas Arboretum
review description: The food and service were both very good. It is worth noting that it can get very loud in the restaurant so it can be very hard to hold a conversation.

name: Z'Tejas Austin 6th St
review description: I was so pleased with the food and service that made out get together so fun. I had guests from out of town and they enjoyed every minute. The food was varied and really well prepared. Good choice I thought!

name: Z'Tejas Avery Ranch
review description: The food is always wonderful, but the service is often slow or inattentive, and don't think of eating indoors if you want to carry on a conversation with more than one person at a time. It is just too loud.
